climbs.name: Seams Like a Dream
climbs.fa: Mike Engle, Brent Kertzman, 1983- ground up

content.description: This was the first route established in the Domensions and is an absolute Black Hills Classic!! A beautiful splitter finger crack that starts  as a low angle slab and gradually gets steeper. Literally swallows gear anywhere you want to place it. No real crux just solid 5.7 the whole way.
content.protection: Take 1 set of stoppers, a #3 cammalot as your first piece & as many finger size cams as you want to place - green Alien-#1 cammalot.   All gear on this  Dream girl!! Two bolt anchor at top.
content.location: Located on the smaller Domention formation - this climb faces due west - shady mornings -sunny afternoons. Look for the obvious splitter! Rappel from two bolt anchor/ 1 - 70 meter rope is just perfect.

content.description:
Spicy! This is a very exciting hybrid route- Place gear when you get the opportunity! P1- 5.10 A stiff Boulder start leads to a right to left slanting very small finger crack- The Crux?- you can make that call - Boulder start or the move at the top! Not a sport pitch! Look for gear after the first Bolt!

 P2 -5.11+       / 5.10 climbing until the exit moves. A good hand and finger crack leads to a puzzling head wall with good holds if your not to pumped to hold on!! Just when the crack seems to end and get wide -there is a great no hands rest - look to the climbers right for a bolt- rest up clip then cast off for some exciting climbing!! There is finger size gear before the last bolts - take it when you can! Exit "stage right"- hard move! You are now in the thick of it Don't clip last bolt too early - a good hold will present itself with patience!
content.protection: P1 3 bolts, micro stoppers,stoppers- green alien to .75 cammalot P2 4 bolts stoppers .3-#3 cammalot -doubles to # 2, if you like to sew it up. 2 bolt Anchors on top of both pitches Again take the gear when it is there
content.location: Located on the Main Domentions Wall 40' right of Left Teepee   Look for 3 bolts on a steep black face.   2 rappels from 2 bolt anchors with 60m rope

climbs.name: Psycho Babble
climbs.fa: Brent Kertzman, Vern Phinney1983 ground up

content.description: this is another 80's  Kertzman creation - a fun thought provoking first pitch that leads to a physical Blue Collar off width Butt crack 2ond pitch.    P1-Follow the vertical crack until it fades - traverse right on slab and crystals to gain next crack.    P2- climb obvious wideness!   If you have big gear get on it just for the experience!!   If not the first pitch is totally worth doing!
content.protection:
P1-Stoppers ,.3-#3 cammalot    P2- big stuff #3-#6 

  P1 New 2 bolt anchor - one 70 meter rope rappel    P2- Walk off or dowm climb and access Seams Like a Dream anchors
content.location: Located on the Smaller Domentions formation look for the vertical crack around the corner 125' (climbers right) of Seams Like a Dream

climbs.name: Motion Sickness
climbs.fa: Brent Kertzman, Mike Miller  1984 Ground Up

content.description: Climb the low angled, bolted face through a smooth looking section about half way up.  The lower slab ends on a flake and the route continues above through another thin face to a double bolt anchor on a good ledge.    The bolts are right where you want them and protect the harder moves quite well.
content.location: 55 feet right of the of the jagged protrusion that is 30' off the ground.

content.description: No real stopper crux, fun climbing definitely do this route if you are there to do Seems Like A Dream.   Some of the bolts are not necessary -good gear, but if you don't have the right size they are appreciated. Clip them or skip them, you make the call if your leading.
content.protection: .4-#4 cammalot, nuts, 6 bolts.   2 bolt anchor on top
content.location: Located Approximately 15 feet left of Seems Like A Dream.   Climb the slab up to a small bolted roof, pull the bulge follow the crack until it ends then bolts  and some more gear to the anchors. 1 -70 meter rope will get you down.

content.description: Four bolts of 5.9 crystal & slab leads to a beautiful 9' over hanging roof finger crack! There is a about a 15 ' easy runout from the last bolt until you reach the roof. Gear is bomber yet "Commiting" to the move is somewhat scary! Sack up and go for it! Once you pull the roof follow the crack to anchors- hands to large hands!
content.protection: 4 bolts - .5- #3 cammalot    Two bolt anchor on top
content.location: This route is located on the northern most Domention formation, and faces southwest. Look for a very dark water streak capped by a 9' over hanging finger roof crack- bolts are just left of the streak. One rope rappell from two bolt anchor.

content.description: Two pitches of exciting climbing if you like hybrid routes!! P1 of Left Teepee goes 5.8 crystal slab to a stemming crack. P2  5.10   A good hand and finger crack leads to a mellow arete finish. Stay in the right to left angling crack until it ends. Place a #4 and top out following the arete and water grove passed one bolt.
content.protection: P1 - 3 bolts stoppers .3-#3cammalot a #4 can be placed but not crucial -90' P2 - 4 bolts stoppers .3-#4 cammalot- extra finger pieces 75' 2 bolt anchor at top of both pitches Rap down from Right Teepee Right anchors
content.location: This climb is the left most route on the Main Domentions wall- look for a slab with 3 bolts low capped by a left to right leaning stemming crack.  The wall faces NE- morning sunshine    2 rappels from 2 bolt anchors with 60meter rope

content.description:
What’s in a name?

Well it was the day after my 40 something  birthday party, on a hot July morning. I was hung over- my drink of choice the night before, Mojito’s!!

Yes, this was the day I was supposed to redpoint my new route..........

After the hike in, lots of hydration and only one burn it was done, & so was I!

Damn Evil Mojito!Technical face Climbing leads to a vertical crack, look for small stopper placements as soon as you reach the crack. Follow the widening crack to the head wall then rest up for 3 more bolts. This route has multiple cruxes, never really lets up. Has not seen much traffic , like most routes this area may have a few suspect  crystals , gear is good and bolts where you want them.Get on it and sip the Mojito!
content.protection: All sizes of stoppers, .3 -#3 Cammalot, 10 bolts,    Bolted chain anchors, 70 m rope just reaches  the ground on the rappel.
content.location: The Main Domention Formation is devided by an obvious large crack/ chimney, this route is Approximately 50’ to the climbers left of this division. NE facing means afternoon shade.

content.description: This route is on you right out of the gate! Technical face climbing leades to a stout crux trying to gain the crack.    There is a bolt near an ok placement for a .75 Cammalot right at the crux -however it will be in a crucial handhold. That is the "Quandry"- Cam - or - Jam??!!  So clip it or skip it you decide!! Place a #4 right after the crux and have fun on a sweet 5.8 hand crack to the chains!!   It was fun trying to figure this route out!
content.protection: 2 bolts - cams .75-#4 Cammalot- doubles #1-#2   2 bolt anchor   Able to access anchors to top rope
content.location: As you approach the New Dementions area you see a large Boulder blocking the path-this is the entry way corridor- the route is on the wall to your left -North -as you pass the Boulder -it is the 4th crack from the climbers left.    This route is shaded morning and afternoon- sees sunshine about 11 am for about 1 hour or so.

content.description: If you like beautiful views of granite domes, moderate approaches, mixed climbs that average 100 feet, & no crowds- this might be the area for you!   Located in the Black Elk Wilderness- New Domentions started seeing development in the 80's by Brent Kertzman and Mike Engle. However, the area continues to evolve with the eyes of a newer generation. Rock quality varies from bullet proof to pretty darn good- depending on which way the route faces. With more traffic routes will clean up nicely- (Remember I mentioned no crowds??!!!)
